inn1.comm: gets the first ball to snake into Tharanga at pace from the off stump line. It is defended off the front foot to mid-off.
similar ball, classic Steyn fare that straightens down the line habitually. Tharanga defends again.
gets Tharanga driving now, pitched up on a length and drawing him forward. Uppishly played to mid-off.
ooh, good short ball, gets Tharanga leaning back in a hurry as it zings through from a length. Nice speeds.
another speed bump. Tharanga ducks under it quickly, this carried better than the previous one.
starts with a maiden does Steyn. Back of a length and seaming in again, Tharanga pushes it from the crease into the covers. An acrobatic save from the man close in denies him the single.
wafted on a fullish length, draws Dilshan forward and he defends. The ball seemed to come on slowly.
shortens the length, and Dilshan attempts his no-room-no-problem carve through the off side. He middles it well, but can't get through the covers.

beaten by a Mick Jagger. Draws Dilshan forward with a good length on off stump, and it additionally stands up as Dilshan leans out, expecting big inward movement. The ball didn't come in so much, and slipped past the outside edge.

Is Dilshan gone? Third umpire looking at the run-out appeal. Short of a length on off stump, Dilshan goes back and forces it into the cover-point. Faf du Plessis prowls at point, and is a superb fielder. Dilshan saw it was going almost straight at him, and realised he had played it off the back foot, and hesitated midway through the run. Mistake. Faf hurls it down to the non-striker's end, and the ball clips the bail after bouncing short. Dilshan is just out of the crease, and then falls on Morne Morkel who was running in from mid-on. Gone. Another duck. 2/5th of the way into the ODI series, the SL captain is yet to get a run.
pitched up and curling slowly in the air. Tharanga covers the line with a seemingly uncertain forward press.
Sri Lanka are away. Tharanga scores his first run in the series with a push into the covers.
a hint of room outside off, Tharanga tries to steer it square, and can't get the gap.

ah, loose from SA. Four over throws for Tharanga and he gets to the non-striker's end. Win-win. Full ball on off stump, driven wide of mid-off for a quick single. The throw missed, and the backing up wasn't great.
good sharp bouncer, Sanga ducks out of the way. Silly mid-on in place, by the way.
pitched up wide of off stump, Sanga leans across and looks at it. But lets it go.
gets closer to off stump, this time Sanga defends solidly down the track.
there, goes for that needless flirt outside off stump, he's been doing it all tour. Doesn't nick this time.
back of a length and cutting in to deny him room. Tharanga defends from the crease.
another one seams in from a length, Tharanga pushes off the inner half of the bat to the leg side.
slower ball, 116 kph and Tharanga adjusts well to defend it into the covers.
another one ducks in from a length, and Tharanga defends towards mid-on.
131 kph on a bouncer a foot and a half outside off. Tharanga sways away from it.
length ball to end the over, Tharanga mistimes a reluctant steer into the off side.
hits the seam straight away, and gets the ball to go away from the left hander. But it started from too wide of Sanga to get him playing.
makes him play at 139 kph from over the stumps. Landed on middle and leg and hinted at angling away, Sanga works it to the leg side.
back of a length and angling across from middle stump line., The speed goes up to 140.5 kph. Sanga defends well, with his head over the ball.

Tharanga escapes being run out! Sri Lanka are finding new ways to get themselves out here. Sanga pushes a short of length ball into the covers, no iota of a chance of a single there, but Tharanga ran almost halfway up after Sanga took a start. Tharanga turned eventually and dived in, but if Duminy had hit the stumps ... would have been curtains.
works one off the pads to the leg side for a single behind square. Sanga is away.
Tharanga covers the line of a length ball and defends down the track. Good, steady start from Morne.
back of a length outside off, Sanga lets it go to the keeper.
back of a length outside off stump, Sanga gets behind the line and defends down the track.
opens the face and defends a length ball to the off side.
keeps it on that nagging length just outside off stump. Sanga lets it go once more.
Lopsy is immovable from that area outside off, and gets the ball to go away from Sanga, who leaves again.
and yet again. Resolute from Sanga, that's not a bad idea. The ball goes away a touch off a length, and Sanga lets go. Maiden to Lopsy.
full length outside off, draws Tharanga forward into a half-hearted push-drive into the covers.
width, and Tharanga finally latches onto one decisively. Short and sitting up nicely, Tharanga slapped it to the right of the man at gully. He didn't have a chance, and SL finally have a boundary.
opens the face and steers one past a rare fumble from du Plessis at point.
full length to Sanga, who moves behind the line nice and early, and blocks to mid-on for a single.
back of a length, and good pace. Pushes Tharanga back in the crease and he defends to the off side.
pearler to end the over. Morne snaps it away off the seam, leaving Tharanga searching down the wrong line with a forward lunge. Need luck to survive those ...
no pace on a short of length ball for Sanga to work with, and he mistimes the cut towards cover-point.
length fare at 131 kph, Sanga leans across cautious to cover the line, and defends.
nothing to drive, nothing to cut. Sanga gets across and defends a back of length ball, with a slightly open face to the off side
straight bat this time as he defends another tight delivery down the track.
Sanga gets a single through mid-on, the moment Lopsy angles in too straight.
shot, Upul! Pitched up, not quite a half-volley, but enough to elicit a forward press and a flowing on the up guided drive through the covers. Superb placement too.
Sanga blocks a back of a length ball that holds its line as it angles across at 139 kph. No run to be had there.
on the hips, Sanga works it to the leg side for a single.
pitched up and zipping across. Sanga moves to 3 off 24 balls with another shouldering of the arms.
fuller length, draws Sanga into the drive now but he finds cover.
Sanga presses forward and drives again, but finds mid-off.
Sanga opens the face and guides towards point to end the over.
short of a length from the niggardly Lopsy, Tharanga tries to cut but bottom-edges to the off side.
this one seamed in a degree. Tharanga defends down the track.
short ball, it was there to be slammed square but the ball took an eternity to come on. Tharanga eventually edged the pull onto his thigh.
back of a length, no room for the cut but Tharanga was setting himself for it and ended up bottom-edging awrily to the leg side.
boy, he's produced the odd bit of sublime timing today. Back of a length, Tharanga waits and punches firmly through the covers. Amla chases and puts in the slide to stop the boundary.

oh Sanga. Goner. He's been resolute all morning, but inevitably pokes at one outside off. That was on a length, not there for the drive or the cut, and probably had to be left alone. Sanga had left alone too many already, and chose to nibble at it. Thin edge, dies on AB, who takes it in front.
back of a length from over the stumps, defended from the crease down the track.
keeps Tharanga back in the crease again, gets him to open the face and steer into the off side. Can't get it past point.

Given out caught behind. Tharanga refers it. Angled across from over the stumps, Tharanga drives away from the body and there seemed to be a noise as the ball crossed the bat. Replays are in, there's no deviation on the ball as it passes the bat, and HotSpot doesn't light up. Poor shot, but no edge by the looks of it. Decision reversed. Tharanga seemed to be smiling from the moment he was given out. Seemed to know he didn't nick it. Technology wins this round.
that snapped across Tharanga, who pushed to point with an opened face. Needs to tighten the screws here. SL can't afford another early wicket.
fuller length on the stumps, Tharanga lunges forward and defends adequately.
width outside off, he lets the ball come on and opens the face to guide it behind point for a single.
tossed up and spinning in slightly. Chandimal watches that closely.
whoa, turn and bounce! Chandimal went back to cut, but that got big on him and hit the bat near the slide before popping dangerously close to slip.
flighted on off stump, defended down the track.
tossed up, gets Tharanga to skip out and take it on the full. He drives nicely, but finds cover.
grip and spin. Herath will like bowling here. If he has some runs to play with. Tharanga opens the face after leaning forward, to cover the line and defend.

boy, what a humongous blow down the ground. Tharanga bottom-hands it into oblivion. He chips out again, gets close to the flight and under the ball. He levers it cleanly, but he wasn't as close to the pitch as he wanted to be, and the ball went higher than he may have wanted. You thought deep mid-on had a chance. No chance. The ball came down a full three seconds or so later, well behind the ropes.
full length, Chandimal watches it homing in and jabs to the leg side.
full again, Albie is getting a sharp inward angle going here. Chandimal adjusts the movement across the stumps and plays to mid-on.
angled in once more, clipped off the pads towards square leg.
short ball outside off, Tharanga hacks it behind square for one.
short ball that doesn't come on, Chandimal mistimes the cut.
angled in from off towards middle. Slightly dangerous play, across the front pad, from Chandimal but he gets bat on it. Single to midwicket.
impressive drive from JP, that curled across landed outside leg and held its line as Chandimal missed a flick.
Chandimal skates out of the pitch and looks to loft through mid-on. Got too close to the flight to time it.
slips down the leg side, Tharanga misses the glance and AB's appeal for catch-behind distracts the umpire Doctrove from calling wide.
Tharanga leans across and opens the face to defend to the off side.
gets forward again and blocks down the track.
armer to end the over, Tharanga spots the line and defends down the pitch.

short ball that comes on slowly, Chandimal goes for a pull and is too early on it. The ball goes off the right arm and balloons towards gully. It is taken, and SA appeal for the catch. Not given, and not reviewed. Chandimal holds the arm and winces, which kind of indicates where the ball hit. Was there a feather on it before it hit the arm? None by the looks of it. Drinks in East London. Chandimal gets some treatment.
110 kph on a length ball, Chandimal works it wide of midwicket and they eventually go for an inevitable single.
short of a length outside off, Tharanga cracks it away behind point for a single.
draws Chandimal forward into the off-drive - the feet moved well there. Pushes it without much timing to mid-off.
short of a length, Chandimal works it onto his thigh as he looks to play to the leg side.
angled into the pads this time, Chandimal is inside the line and clips it square for a single.
angles the first one into the pads, and Chandimal indulges in some freebies through the leg side with a neat flick of the wrists.

part-controlled, part-edged, but four runs for Chandimal. Short ball at 140 kph hustles through Chandimal faster than he imagined. He shaped for the square cut, didn't have the room or the time to work with and thick-edged it fine over where slip would have been.
fuller, draws him into the check-drive to the off side.
slow bumper at 129 kph, tempting Chandimal into an early pull, but he wisely backed away. Called one for the over. That went down the leg side, so Steyn got away with it.
on the pads from a short length, and Chandimal works it too fine. Picks the man at 45 degrees on the leg side.
back of a length, not there for the drive as Chandimal reaches across. He defends to the off side.
tossed up from over the stumps on middle and off. Tharanga blocks.
steps across to a length ball on off and defends again.

played Tharanga. Goes over mid-off and gets enough elevation to beat the man inside the circle. He danced out, and towards the leg side, looking to create room, knowing Robbie wasn't going to give him any. He then consciously went over the off side. If he'd dragged it across, it could have been a catch. SL go past 43.
ah, he drags it across now. Fortunately for him, he doesn't time the chip-out-and-loft too well. Lands short of long-on.
Chandimal defends to the leg side as Robbie tosses up on off stump.
drifts onto the pads, Chandimal works it to midwicket for a single.
back of a length outside off, Chandimal taps to point for one.
length ball on Tharanga's pads, easily tucked through backward square leg for a couple. The runs are coming finally. SL need to keep up the intensity though. No gifted wickets, please.
back of a length, and straightening down the line. Pushes Tharanga back and he defends to the off side.
draws him forward with a fuller length, and Tharanga drives through cover point for one.

edges a pull, perilously close to the stumps. Chandimal gets away with it. That was Steyn pace, on a bumper wide of off stump and Chandimal was late on an ambitious pull. The bottom edge runs past the stumps and AB for one.
another short ball, Tharanga doesn't want anything to do with it.
loopy, tempting flight from round the stumps. Chandimal comes out of the crease but then covers the line and defends.
straighter, nudged to the leg side and Robbie is onto it in a flash.
straight again, this time Chandimal works it square and gets the single away.
Tharanga dabs a full ball with the turn behind square leg for one.
flatter length, Chandimal goes back and pushes through wide mid-on for one.
aha, they think of a dodgy single and then change their minds. On Tharanga's pads and he works it straight to short fine leg. Chandimal charged out too far, and charged right back to make his ground.
angles one across Chandimal at a full length, gets him pushing forward uncertainly. The ball holds its line and takes the outside edge towards point.
ooh, slow finger-rolled offcutter at 118 kph, and fools Chandimal all ends up as he leans out and gropes. It dodges past the outside edge, just did enough to miss it.
fuller now, draws Chandimal forward and he defends.
another trundled offcutter, full on the stumps, defended with caution from the crease.
too straight now, Chandimal turns it away behind square for a single.
pitched up to Tharanga, who defends with a semi-closed face to the leg side.
flighted on off stump, Chandimal drives it back to Robbie P.
flat armer, Chandimal mistimes the cut. He didn't read it coming in.
loopy from over the stumps, Tharanga turns it with the angle behind square.
on the pads once more, there are men on either side of square inside the circle to stop the single. Tharanga can't beat them.
pushes one through mid-on, but midwicket nearly got there. du Plessis again, if he had, there could have been a run out since Chandimal was steaming down the track by then.
on the pads to end the over, worked with the angle towards square leg.
angled in at a full length at 129 kph, Chandimal clips uppishly through square leg for one.
edged behind, doesn't carry. Albie nips it away off the seam, but the ball came on too slowly. Tharanga was trying to cover the line, but thin-nicked it and it landed short of AB.
du Plessis at point saves another run. Tharanga chops a short ball in front of square and thinks of one. du Plesses wouldn't have any of that.
shortens the length, the ball doesn't come on at all. Tharanga pushes it back down the pitch.
short ball, Tharanga pulls without middling the ball, through midwicket for a single.
back of a length, a hint of width outside off allowing Chandimal to open the face and dab behind square for one.
turning in from outside off, Chandimal works it to the leg side.
stays back and nudges with the angle to the leg side once again.
third time lucky with the dab through the leg side. Single through wide mid-on.
short of a length and spinning in. Tharanga goes back and guides it through the covers for a single.
short of a length and spinning away, Chandimal hacks it square for one more.
that spun in sharply, Tharanga went to cut and had no room to play with, but managed to fend it away.
works a length ball behind square for a single.
width to Chandimal, he lashes it away powerfully behind square, but finds third man.
slower ball, offcutter grips and stops at 109 kph. Tharanga had to check his firm defence, but it still went uppishly down the track. Lands safely to the right of Albie though.

Tharanga takes off, and finds a good vacant gap at long-on to pick up four. Another slower ball, Tharanga seemed early on the shot, but went through with it and got it to fly within ten yards of the fence.
short now, Tharanga pulls well and Amla charges across from fine-leg to cut off four. Superb work for a father in the making.
fifty to Tharanga, he's done well here, but needs to bat through this innings now. Full and on the pads, he deflects it to fine-leg and scampers back for a second run.
tossed up on middle, Chandimal leans across and laps it over his left shoulder for a couple.
back of a length and spinning in, worked from the crease behind square.
short ball, Chandimal latches on with a guided pull through square leg.
tries to steer one through the off side, but point is in the way.
flighted, draws Tharanga forward and gets him to play it back down the track.
skips out now, has the room to go big over the off side, but he checks his loft over the covers. Single to the sweeper.

width to Tharanga, just a sliver of it, and he cashes in superbly. Backs away a degree to make some more and gets the wrists to open up as he slashes behind point. The timing is good enough to beat Steyn at third man.
width again, Tharanga cuts to the deep for another single.
Chandimal tries the cut now, but that man at point - du Plessis - makes another electric save.
slow offcutter at 111 kph. Expect one an over from Albie. Tharanga spots it and defends to mid-on carefully.
another slower ball, 110 kph, but on the pads this time and allows Tharanga to nurdle it to fine leg for one.
third slower ball on the trot. Chandimal waits for it to turn in, and pushes towards long-on for one more.
tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the turn to the leg side.
draws Chandimal forward into a push through the covers. Albie fumbles it in the covers and they get a single by the time Morne comes around to back up his brother.

Chandimal escapes a run out! Tharanga works it square and sets up, so does AB, who relinquishes the glove as he hares after it. He had to turn and throw in one go, and missed by a foot or so. Chandimal was well out.
Chandimal works a single through the covers
finally an extra. JP pushes one down the leg side and it called wide.
tossed up on middle and leg, Tharanga drives to long-on for a single.
turning in from outside off, Tharanga dabs it against the turn behind square, but misses the gap.

slapped back with power and disdain. Good shot from UT, considering the leg side boundaries are plugged. Short and spinning in, he went back and slapped it straight past Petersen instead of pulling it, and collects four more.
tossed up and worked towards long-on for one.
London buses. Another extra. Another wide down the leg side.
nudged with the angle to the leg side. Ah, no bat on it, so a leg bye. Three extra now.
full ball on off stump, Tharanga defends to the off side watchfully.
goes back and looks for another big blow down the ground. But this time he's a little late on the shot and gets a single to deep midwicket instead.
back of a length and angling across, Tharanga chops a single through backward point.
short ball sprayed down the leg side. Chandimal pulls it straight to fine leg, but keeps it down.

ah, tragic for SL. Just as he was looking super-ominous, Tharanga is gone. Short of a length and angled across, not too much pace, no sideways movement. Not much room to work with. Tharanga did what he's done efficiently all day - he attempted to make some room and steer with an open-face to third man, but this time he edges it into AB's gloves. Well played, given the circumstances, but he'll hurt on the way back in.
length ball on off stump to start off, defended to the off side.
keeps it on a length outside off, Mahela has a close look at it and leaves.
short of a length to end the over, another leave outside the off stump from Mahela.
tossed up on the off stump, Chandimal defends.
looped up on the leg stump line, Chandimal tries to shovel it over the leg side, but can't connect too well.
pitched well up, Chandimal yorkes himself nearly but keeps it out.
Chandimal needs to buckle down here. Another slug over the leg side attempted, this time he squirts it over midwicket without conviction for one.
Mahela whips one off the toes, but straight to the fielder.
armer to end the over, Mahela defends it cautiously.
short of a length outside off, Chandimal's chop doesn't beat point.

short and wide, Mahela stands tall and cracks it elegantly through point. Boy, the ropes are pulled in by about 15 yards in that region. Albie does well to stop the four after charging across from third man.
on the pads, worked with the angle towards square leg.
fuller length, gets Mahela to press forward and defend down the track.
two spread slips and a gully in place, and Mahela finds a gap between them, deliberately, with a guided steer to a short ball outside off.
slow short ball, came on ages after Chandimal got into the pull shot, but he still managed to laboriously drag it down to fine leg for a single.
tossed up and drift towards the pad, Chandimal works it square for a single.
tossed up to Mahela now, and he drives through mid-off cautiously.
Chandimal skips out a drives a full ball, but he can't get it past Robbie, who is a phenomenal fielder off his own bowling.
full again, can't do much with that, Chandimal. He defends.
jumps out, gets too close to the flight and struggles to time the flick as a result. Straight to midwicket now.
tossed up to end the over, Chandimal still stuck as he looks to drive. Drinks break.

offbreak straightens down the line as Mahela leans out. It hits the pad and jumps up to the leg side. AB comes around to take it and goes up in appeal for a bat-pad catch. JP wasn't interested, neither was the umpire.
Mahela paddles with the turn from outside off and gets a single.
Chandimal is getting bogged down. Skips out once more, gets too close and then digs the ball out meekly down the track.
gets the single now, pushing the drive down to long-on.
works one off the pads towards square leg.
flatter, Chandimal goes back and defends down the track.
flighted, another jump out of the crease from Chandimal and he can't time the drive at all. Robbie dives across to stop it.
back of a length, he goes back and forces a single into the covers now.

Appeal for a run out, and it goes upstairs. I think Chandimal is in. Mahela gets this away towards Amla at short third man, and Chandimal charges down the track for a non-existent single. He turned around at the last moment, and the throw was intercepted by Robbie who was in front of the stumps. Chandimal makes his ground by the time Robbie can collect and break the stumps. Should he have been behind the stumps? Didn't have much time, mind you. It might have hit the stumps ... Wasn't a bad throw.
Mahela works a single in front of square on the leg side.
Chandimal opens the face and looks to steer through the off side, but can't hit the gap.
gets the single now with a push through wide mid-on.
short ball, turning in from outside off, Chandimal cuts for a single.
on Mahela's pads from round the stumps, easy pickings as he turns it behind square for a single.
Chandimal gets a single after skipping out this time, nudging with the turn through midwicket.
looped up full toss outside off, Mahela forces it through mid-off for one more.
flighted on the stumps, worked with the angle towards square leg.
another one on the pads, clipped towards fine leg to end the over.
and beaten right away. Gets a ball to buzz in from a length outside off, Chandimal has a whimsical waft at it and misses.
short ball outside off, he cuts efficiently past point and picks up a single.
Morne angles one down the leg side, and a wide it is.
back of a length outside off, steered with an opened face towards point.
attacks the stumps now with a fuller length, and Mahela defends down the track.
that came in off the seam, Mahela dabbed softly into the off side and took a single.
ugly ball, uglier shot. 137 kph on one that seamed away from three feet wide of off stump. Chandimal has a wild swing and misses, and it is wided.
cuts the angle this time and cramps Chandimal with one that came in. He defends after getting too far across.
short ball at 138 kph, Mahela eyes midwicket with a controlled pull, but Kallis limbers around to cut it off. They get two.
stays back in the crease and works a length ball to the leg side. Midwicket swoops in on it.
another pacy short ball, another smooth pull from Mahela, this time he times it even better, so just a single before Kallis sends in the return.

Chandimal escapes another run-out! Goes back to a short ball, tries a pull and ends up heaving it straight to Amla at mid-on. He goes for the single nevertheless, Amla has a lot of time to throw down the stumps, and misses by a whisker's whisker.
Mahela tries to be cheeky now, steering from literally the off stump line. He misses.
another short ball, Mahela pulls once more and Kallis keeps him to a single again.

Mahela plays the shot of the day, and his shot of the tour. Length ball at 125 kph, comes through into the slot and Mahela sets up with a step down the track and missile launches it down the ground for four. Keeps the head down as he plays it, and that makes it look even more classy.

holy cow! Is that a plane? is that Jonty Rhodes? No, that's Dale Steyn! Morne angles a length ball into Mahela's pads, and it is there to be helped along to fine leg. Mahela makes very good connection as he moves inside the line and whip-glances. Steyn is inside the circle at short file leg. He moves to his left, takes off and plucks it when he's nearly fully horizontal, with both hands. Shades of McGrath's catch of Vaughan in Adelaide, many years ago, in the age when Australia used to win the Ashes. Who said fast bowlers can't field. Superb take!
short of a length and wide of off stump, Kula stays back and thinks of a slash, but misses.
another one short and wide of off stump, this bounced extra too. Kula can't lay bat on ball.
swing and a miss now. The feet go nowhere, the bat swings wildly in a different zip code.
Kula is early on a check drive to the off side now, and he nearly pops a catch into the covers. The ball lands just short, though.
now Steyn gets one past the outside edge as Kula swings and misses. He's not covering himself in glory so far in his 100th ODI.

Kula's getting reverse swing with the bat now. He backs away to a short, pacy ball angling in and has no room to do anything but tonk-waft in hope. The ball somehow takes the outside edge and goes between keeper and wide slip. Steyn is livid.

whoa, proof that if you keep swinging, you will eventually connect with one! Kula gets under a length ball and absolute destroys it over midwicket. Bashed the core out of that one, an utter slamdunk of a stroke, that.
short again, cramping him for room with a short ball and Kula backs away to try and make something out of it. Can't get bat on it.

what a deliciously entertaining over, this! Kula goes to the right of slip now with another thick edge that absolutely flies. Full from Steyn, looking to twirl past the edge into the stumps, but Kula somehow connects and gets it past the slip fielder.
and beaten again. Slower ball to end the over, just outside off and Kula tries steering through the off side, and misses. 14 runs off the over, Kula was beaten three times and edged twice!
that's just what he does. Short of a length outside off, he chops it to point and takes off immediately.
Kulasekara! Goes back in the crease and rocket-launches a length ball straight over Lopsy's head. Man, he's connecting with them now.
back of a length outside off, cutting the angle and the length. Kula spars it away through point for one.
angled into the pads, Chandimal does the wise thing, working it through square leg for one more. Two balls of Powerplay left.

You thought that Steyn catch was a classic? Petersen says hang on, I have some more entertainment. Kula goes back and looks for another straight loft, but doesn't time it that well. Robin is inside the circle at mid-on, and runs back half the way from East London to London proper, looking back over his right shoulder all the time. He then lunges full length forward towards the ropes and the ball tumbles into his palms as he sprawls. South Africa - setting high fielding standards since 1992, only to raise the bar soon after.
Chandimal has 50. Works a ball angling into the pads through square leg for two. Not his best innings, but he has enough time left in the game to make it truly substantial.
tossed up on the stumps, driven through the mid-off area for one.
well played. Chandimal gets right across and lap sweeps through fine leg. Lopsy puts in a big effort on the rope, but he can't stop it cleanly.
angled into the pads, worked with the wrists towards square leg. A single is taken.
tossed up on off stump, Angelo defends down the track.
another flighted ball on off stump, defended down the track off the front foot.
flighted into the pads now, Angelo defends cautiously to end the over.
Lopsy goes full from over the stumps, cramps Chandimal for room and he defends out of balance.
short ball, if that caught Chandimal by surprise he didn't show it. He arches back and guides it along towards third man for a single.
Angelo gets away with a miscue, he manages to get it far enough away from a fielder, and for a South African fielder, that means he got it 20 yards away. Full ball, mishit over wide mid-on.

some luck going SL's way here. Chandimal goes for the good old heave-ho over the leg side, except the ball was well outside off and angling further across. He gets a healthy outside edge that flies away over point. Three men converge, but the ball lands in between.
full ball to Mathews, who leans forward and drives it through mid-off for one.
much better from Chandimal, who pushes a drive into the covers to get a single and keep strike.
not for the first time today, Chandimal gets too close to the stumps and digs a full ball out without timing. "Great dot ball there, Robbie P!" yells AB behind the stumps.
armer that comes in from outside off, Chandimal forces it away into the covers for one.

inside out from Angelo. He skips out of the crease and to the leg side, so that he gets well outside the line and then whips it over the covers with a furious working of the wrists. The ropes are pulled in too far to contain that.
attacks the leg stump line this time, Angelo tries working it square but can't get it away.
flatter length, Angelo opens the face and steers to point.
flat length to end the over, Chandimal tucks it square for a single.
well played Dinesh. Short and wide, it was there for damage, and Chandimal responded with a  fierce little cut behind point and well in front of third man.
fuller length, Chandimal moves forward and across and looks to steer, but there's a deep gully in a run saving position who parries it away.
Angelo gives Morne the charge, and the ball is pitched short and wide of off stump. Harsh call for a wide.
gets a single away through backward point, opening the face and steering efficiently.
pacy offcutter now, Chandimal lunges too far across before adjusting and blocking.
another one that seams in, Chandimal works it with the angle behind square for one.
fends a short ball on the hips behind square and gets another single. SL looking good for 235 here.
slower ball at 117 kph from Steyn, Angelo steers it with a loose grip but finds short fine leg.
back of a length again, this time 138 kph and Mathews prances behind the line to defend.
gets the single away now, pushing with soft hands into the point region.
ah, Chandimal misses out. 119 kph, slipping down the leg side, Chandimal misses the whip and the ball kisses his pad too, so he doesn't get the wide either.
back of a length, and hurrying through at 139 kph. Chandimal is late to react, but works it away to the leg side where sloppy Lopsy fumbles and allows a second.
another quick, short of length ball, this time Chandimal works it behind square for another single.
Morne angles in from wide of the stumps, into the pads and worked to midwicket. SL have 200, and look good for some more.
137 kph on a short ball, but it still stopped on Mathews as he chipped out and looked to play into the off side. Pushed uppishly to mid-off for one.
short again, Chandimal heaves it away without timing to long-on. Looked awry, but who cares... Single taken.
subtle pace variations here. 128 kph, the length ball came on fashionably late, after Mathews had played the pull.
125 kph on an offcutter now, Mathews hops and dabs to the off side for a single.
Morne escapes with a short ball slanted down the leg side. Chandimal pulls well, but straight to Steyn at fine leg.
heave ho. Four more. Offcutter from Lopsy, Chandimal looked to bang it against the angle through the leg side, and ended up getting a thick outside edge up and over point.

and another! Chandimal is producing some comical boundaries here. This one was angling in from wide of the stumps, he moves the front foot across and looks to lap it over, but ends up playing it onto his own helmet! The ball deflects and takes off over AB and all the way for four. That's like a header in football!
looks to steer one outside off, and misses to make connection.
more runs. He nurdles with Lopsy's angle through square leg and hares back for the second. 50-run stand up. Sri Lanka are fighting superbly here.
another one angled in, worked through square leg for a single.
Angelo backs away and dabs a short of length ball through backward point for one more.
low full toss on the toes, ah, Angelo misses out on some freebies. He whips it with ominous timing, but straight to midwicket.
slower ball, 118 kph and back of the length, giving him no room for working, and Mathews gets a single away to the leg side.
full length, homing in towards the pads and whipped through midwicket for one.
near yorker, but Mathews gets an inch under it to drive down the ground. Only a single to be had.

Chandimal is having a go at that 100! Walks across the stumps once more, Steyn delivers a nice length ball and Chandimal slaps it over his left shoulder for four to fine leg. Dilshan would be proud of that shot.

chance? Steyn can't react soon enough on his follow through. Full length, gets Chandimal driving back down the ground a touch early and it flies to Steyn's left. He is late on it, and doesn't even get a hand on the chance.
Mathews is taking his runs this time around. Length ball outside off, punched to long-off for one.
angled into Chandimal who looks to shovel it to the leg side and gets a single.
Mathews blocks a length ball softly to the off side and gets another single. Should he be looking for the boundary instead of singles?
full length at 119 kph, Chandimal plants himself in the crease and looks to lash it down the ground but can't time it well. Single to long-on is all he gets for the effort.
angled in and cramping him for room, Mathews seems set on looking for the single to cover, and this time Lopsy cuts it off.
Lopsy ends well, angling in and ending up on off stump. Mathews taps to cover for a single. He has strike for the last over.

that's better from Mathews! He is looking for the boundaries. Length ball from Steyn comes into the slot and Mathews cross-bats with a vengeance through midwicket. It carries to Faf who runs in from the ropes, but he can't get the hands under it. Should he have stayed back to stop the four instead?
audacity personified, is Angelo. He moves across and cheekily laps the world's best fast bowler behind square for a couple now.
short ball, carved to deep cover for a single. Over to Chandimal.
ah, he's conceded a dot ball. Short of a length, but pacy and through him before he can get the cut away.

no century for Chandimal then (unless there are wides and no-balls, as Gavaskar would remind us). Short of a length, and he looks to heave to the leg side. Bottom-edges a single to midwicket. Played, young man.

and a wicket to end the innings. Mathews tries to create room and go over mid-off, but the ball stops on him and he toe-ends to Morne at mid-off. Sri Lanka will want the slowness to continue in the chase - this pitch is right up their alley.

inn2.comm: full ball on middle and leg at 138 kph, Smith nudges to mid-on to open the scoring.
length to Amla, who stays behind the line and defends.

run out missed! Amla tucks one off the pads straight to midwicket. There was no single there, but Amla took off and Smith responded, Amla saw Chandimal hurrying in and backed out of it, selling Smith a proper dummy. Smith scrambled back in, Chandimal missed the stumps.
Amla is away, works one through midwicket for a single.
back of a length and angling across, Smith defends in front of point.
full an pacy on off stump, Smith leans across and guides to point.

and he gets the big inswinger going right away. This one came in too far, and hit Amla's pads high and as it headed down the leg side. Amla was looking to work it into the leg side, but it came in big.
length ball outside off, Amla leans out and check-drives into the covers.
on Amla's pads, this time he gets it away through midwicket with a polite turning of the wrists.
slips down the leg side, Amla goes for a flick-whip and by the looks of it got no bat on that. It kisses the pad on the way, so no wide. Sanga appealed, all the same, for the catch.
there, another prodigious indipper. Amla gets into a knot as he gets across and looks to work it to the leg side. Hit on the pad on the move again.
stays back in the crease to cover the line this time, and defends down the line. End of a lively over.
back of a length, Smith is behind the line and defends down the track.
short of a length and angling across, Smith tries to cut but doesn't have the room.
whips it in full on middle and leg, and Smith defends as he gets across.
short of a length, Smith nudges it off the hips to midwicket and sets off for a well-judged single.
short of a length outside off, Amla stays back and forces it into the covers.
slow offcutter, 124 kph and it comes into Amla, who spots it and defends carefully.
Kula slants one across Smith, luring him into a drive that ended up as a thick outside edge behind point. Single taken.
short outside Amla's off stump, and he punches it with good timing to cover.
Amla at his very best. He's banged Kula inside-out over extra cover for a six. Length ball - not there for the drive - Amla stepped towards it and lashed it through the line. Boy, what timing.
Kula cuts the room immediately with that inward movement. Amla looks to work it off the pads, and can't get bat on it. Leg-bye taken to the leg side.
that starts from too wide of Smith and keeps going away, he shoulders arms.
Amla walks across the stumps and works Kula from the line of middle towards backward square leg. Good thing he got bat on that one.
back of a length and at a wobbly pace. Defended to the off side from the crease.
back of a length, Amla goes back and dabs behind square.

well played, Smith. Not the best ball Mathews will bowl. Short and angling across when there's no protection in the deep. Smith chopped in front of square and beat cover-point. There was no other hindrance in the way.
slower ball cuts away from off stump, and Smith defends carefully.
angled across from a fuller length, drawing Smith forward and he defends towards point.
on the pads, nudged easily through square leg for one more.
Kula again starts the swing from wide of off stump, and Smith leaves easily. He's looking pretty organised today.

on the pads as Smith walks across the stumps, and he tries working it square for a single. Another yes-no situation as Chandimal comes into the frame, but this time they decide against it nice and early.
fuller and on off stump, Smith's walking all over the place. Works it off the pads to midwicket again.
Smith again conscientiously works a ball curling across him to midwicket and gets a single.

Cricket comes rarely to East London, and Amla is giving the crowd some shots they will remember until the next game here. He steps into the line poetically and flicks Kula with the angle over midwicket for four of the most pleasing runs ever.
the indipper keeps Amla in the crease and he tucks to the leg side.
back of a length on the stumps, Smith works it to the leg side of the pitch and Prasad cleans up.
angled across Smith from over the stumps, and he drops it into the covers for a single.
angled into the pads, Amla whips it well but finds the fielder at midwicket.
short of a length outside off, Amla rides the bounce and guides towards third man for a single.
angled across at 136 kph, Smith opens the face and steers to point. The fumble doesn't cost a run.
a leading edge was imminent given how he's been walking across the stumps. It stays down and goes to point, though.

Amla is putting on an exhibition here. Keeper is up, there's no room for the cuts and the length isn't there for the drive. What does Amla do? He gets the front foot in, making Kula's swing to work for him, and flicks emphatically over deep square leg for six.
stays behind the line and defends now.
on the pads again, whipped square for a single.
on Smith's pads now, and he nudges to midwicket. This is just the start SA needed, given the conditions.
appeal for lbw, turned down and not referred. Smith was caught in the crease, but where did that pitch? Landed outside leg and even hit outside the line as Smith missed the flick.
on the pads again, worked square for a single.
pitched up at 135 kph, Smith responds with a solid, organised forward defensive.
ah, nice pacy short ball, Smith was late on the pull and takes a blow in the midriff. Ouch.
width now, Smith walks into a half-steer half-drive behind point and gets a single.

Amla is oozing class and it is dripping all over the pitch now. Short ball slips into the slot and Amla rocks back and helps it along as smoothly as possible behind square leg. The ball seemed pleased to rush to the fence.
back of a length outside off, chopped behind square for a single.
full ball on off stump, Smith is reluctant to get forward but squeezes it away through square leg for one.
Former skipper of SA welcomes current skipper of SL with a boundary. Rubbish ball, short and wide of off stump in the Powerplay, and Smith strokes it away from the crease through backward point.
tossed up, much better, draws Smith out to defend to the off side.
angled in from round the stumps into the pads, and it is tucked square for one.
flat ball outside off, whipped with the wrists through square for one.
tossed up on off stump, Smith presses forward and defends back to the bowler.
flat ball, Smith plays from the crease to the off side.
full length to Amla, easily guided behind point for one. SA have 50 without loss and SL must be sweating.
fuller length to Smith, he leans across and drives in front of point for a single.
short of a length outside off stump, defended from the crease towards backward point.
full to Smith at 133 kph, and defended down the track with a full face.
Smith absolutely murders a short ball, but his spanking pull finds the man at deep midwicket.
angled in at 135 kph, Amla's straight bat comes down decisively and he plays it to mid-on.
short of a length and looking to angle across Smith, who works it to midwicket.
short and angling across, forced from the crease towards point.
Amla inches across his crease unnoticed and whips Kosala from outside off through square leg. The bowling is getting toyed with now.
short of a length, Amla drops it into the covers and gets a single. SL nearly concede an overthrow. Can do without those.
length ball angled across, Smith works it to the leg side for a single.
back of a length to Amla, he forces another single into the covers. Smooth sailing.
gets some drift on this outside off, and Amla misses a drive. Not a poor ball, that.
ah there you go. Part-time bowling, party-time for the batsmen. Short ball outside off, Amla waits and expertly opens the face to use the pace and get four through third man.
party time continues. Dilshan slips this quick and down the leg side, Amla helps it along to fine leg with a subtle glance.
Amla goes back to a length ball on off and pushes a single into the covers.
Smith gets a full length ball at 87 kph and defends to the off side off the front foot.
loopy outside off, Amla punches through cover point without a fuss.
tossed up on the stumps, Smith sweeps it away behind square for one.
tossed up, gets Amla to lean out and drive through the covers. Elegantly done.
flat, length ball. Smith pushes it down the ground for a single.
arm ball, Amla didn't spot it as he went back to cut, but he managed to keep it out.
tossed up slowly, Amla is late to come forward but defends.
tossed up on the pads, Smith chips out and works it to mid-on.
holds the length back a touch, Smith watches it turn and defends to the off side.
on the pads now, easy run for Smith and he works a single through square leg.
Amla leans forward and defends a full ball.
slows this up, Amla adjusts and works it in the air to the leg side. But he has it under control.
on Smith's pads now and he punches through wide mid-on for another single. Drinks in East London.
slow offcutter, gets Smith's edge as he leans out and looks to play to the off side. The edge doesn't carry to the keeper though. Far from it.
short ball, Smith stays back and defends down the track.
pitched fuller outside off, gets Smith pressing forward and pushing into the covers.
length offcutter on the stumps, played back down the pitch off the middle. Malinga half-stops it.
proper yorker, and well played by Smith, who gets his toes out of the way and jams down on it.
pitched well up on the stumps, Smith on-drives to midwicket.
angled into the pads, worked with the angle through midwicket. This is looking easy for SA.
Smith wanders down the track, Prasad tucks him up with a tight line on leg stump, and Smith defends.

a wicket out of nowhere. A gift from Smith. Can Sri Lanka make this work for them? Short ball at the body, it was there for the pull, but Smith just played an inch lower than he should have and top-edged it. Easy catch for Tharanga close in on the leg side.
slow offcutter, Amla dabs it away behind square for one.

Kallis gets going with a sumptuous pull off his first ball. Short and sitting up, Kallis went for it immediately, though he was looking away from the ball as he played it. Didn't matter. Placement perfect, timing better.
stays back in the crease and defends to the off side.
full length ball on off stump, defended down the track.
full and wide of off stump, Amla opens the face and steers through third man for a single.
pitched up wide of off stump, Kallis chops it with an angled face towards point.
short of a length outside off, Kallis looks to cut but can't find the gap.
full length on the stumps, Kallis plays it to midwicket now.
slower ball at 121 kph, Kallis seemed to read it right out of the hand. He waits and waits and steers it behind square for four. Malinga smiles, Kallis just walks back to his mark.
full ball, Amla defends to mid-on.
opens the face to an offcutter and steers behind point.
back of a length outside off, Amla cuts but can't beat the fielder at point.

fifty to Amla, seemed inevitable since the time he walked out. Back of a length outside off, and he slides it off the face of the bat towards third man. A little present, this 50, for the new addition to his family that's on the way.
short ball from Prasad, Kallis whip-pulls behind square for a single.
back of a length, Amla gets another single with a dab to third man.
pitched well up, Amla drills it off the middle of the middle of the bat to mid-off.
short ball now, outside off and Amla drops the wrists to let it go.
another short ball, Amla thinks of the pull this time and lets go. These are very tempting speeds from Kula.

the moment he pitches one up, Amla blazes him over the covers. High elbow, bent knee, straight bat, but in the air. Geoff Boycott would have approved of parts of that shot, Virender Sehwag of other parts.
full length again, Amla drives into the covers but finds the fielder.
full toss and he gets away with it since the covers are well protected. Amla drills it straight to one of them.
back of a length outside off, Kallis chops it behind point.
slower ball at 110 kph, Kallis drives straight to mid-on
back of a length this time, Kallis defends to the off side.
short of a length, Kallis steers towards third man for one.

whoa, Prasad has gone right through Hash. Amla was batting on a pristine plane, and looked capable of doing anything. He tried to play this across the line, it wasn't on a full length, and that just made the shot more dangerous. Amla misses for once, and Prasad gets the inward seam to come in and spread-eagle his stumps.
short of a length on the hips, worked square for one.
length ball spinning in from outside off, and JP lets it go.
stays in the crease and forces a length ball through mid-on to open his account.
armer, lbw appeal, Herath joins in it late and Sri Lanka are considering reviewing it. They decide against. Kallis got an inside edge, so he was safe.
big spin! Across the face of Kallis' bat as he leans out and searches.
stays back to one that comes on quicker and plays to the off side.
full toss outside off to end the over, Kallis slaps it over to square leg for a single.
back of a length outside Kallis' off stump and he punches it off the back foot through point for a single.
full length on off stump, Duminy defends fluently into the covers.
another full ball, JP shows the full face as he defends to the off side.
back of a length, JP moves across and opens the face with a flourish to get a single.
full to Kallis, who punches to the left of mid-on and gets another single.
on the pads, easy tuck through square leg gives JP a single.

another straighter one, another rap on the pads. The appeal is turned down again. Dilshan is itching to review this. Sanga doesn't look convinced. They go for it! That angled in, landed on middle and leg and seemed to carry on down the leg side. Kallis tried to work it to the leg side and missed. Replays are in, that's missing leg. Kallis survives, and SL have no more reviews.
Kallis has played down the wrong line to Herath four times now. Another ball comes in straight and he misses.
gets bat on it now, and plays it into the off side.
flighted on middle and leg, Kallis skips out and flicks through midwicket for a single.
goes back and forces Herath against the spin through backward point for a couple.
tossed up, drives to long-on for one more.
short ball outside off, Duminy tries cutting but it is far from him.
gets a single now, driving him with the turn into the covers.
Kallis inside edges onto the pad and it pops up on the leg side, but there's no one to catch it.
works with the turn and gets a single through square leg.
full toss on the middle and leg line, driven down to long-on for a single.
flighted on off stump and spinning in, Kallis whips it square for a single.
Herath tosses it up, Kallis calmly drives down to long-off for a single.
goes back in the crease does JP, and pushes a single to long-on.
looped up on off stump, Kallis drives to long-off for a single.
flighted on off stump, JP slides out and works it to long-on for one more.

the umpteenth lbw appeal against Kallis from Herath, again turned down. This time beaten by the turn, and not the lack of it. That landed outside off and straightened, with Kallis playing inside the line. Missing the off stump.
better from Kallis, defends to the off side off the front foot.
flat on the stumps, JP goes back and plays down to long-on for one.
Kallis works Dilshan easily with the spin towards midwicket.
short and spinning away, JP chops to sweeper cover for a single.
flighted to Kallis who defends to the off side for a quick single.
flighted from round the stumps, JP laces it down the ground for a single.
tossed up again to end the over, Kallis defends compactly.
flighted on middle and leg from round the stumps, JP defends it back to the bowler.
good milking from JP, who drives with the turn to long-on for one more.
Kallis plays down the right line, and works Herath into the off side.
gets the front pad across and lap-scoops Herath over short fine leg for a single.
and he does it again! Dilshan charges around to the leg side from slip even as he shapes for the paddle, but Kallis gets it well away from him for two more.
floater outside off, defended to the off side.
goes back to a short ball and cuts for a single.
played that with such soft hands that it spun back, but away from the stumps.
Kallis gets across and tries nudging with the turn to the leg side. SL appeal for something, but the umpire isn't interested.
defends with the spin to midwicket now.
flighted, Kallis drives hard down the ground for a single to long on
flighted and straigtening into JP who defends.
that curled in with the arm, Kallis inner-edges it towards square leg for one.
JP plays back to a ball he might have rather played forward to, but manages to keep out a tossed up ball to the leg side.
works with the turn to the leg side again.
too short, JP is allowed to milk a single with a forceful punch to long-on.
flat ball, Kallis goes back and drives into the covers for one.
JP leans right across and chips a tossed up ball uppishly inside the circle on the leg side and gets a single.
flighted outside off, JP leans across and drives into the covers.
shorter, JP rocks back and cuts behind point. Short third man charges in and there's no single.
tossed up on off, JP reaches across and defends to the off side.
tries to work a short ball off the hip, but can't get it away.
short and spinning away, Dilshan cuts it away through cover-point for one.
flighted into the pads, Kallis whips it through midwicket.
Kallis bounds out of the crease but can't reach the pitch, and tries to defend. It goes off the pad to the off side.
JP's turn to skip out and drive down the ground, he gets a single to long-on.
Kallis tries to press forward and block, and gets an outside edge into the off side.
gets a ball spinning in from outside off, and defends.
short ball, JP leans back to cut it square for a single. That's drinks for the last time today.
slow and low full toss on JP's pads, he clips it square for a single.
pitched up outside off, Kallis drives into the covers fluently but can't find the gap.
another low full toss, Kallis drives to the left of the covers and gets a single.
whoa, slides a full ball past JP's angled face and Sri Lanka appeal for the catch behind. Bat hit turf and the ball nothing. It was another yorker, and JP was trying to squeeze it behind point
another low full toss on the pads, worked with good timing wide of mid-on for a single.
another full toss, this time not low enough to create problems. Kallis drills it right back down the ground for four. Superb timing.
tries the yorker first up, and JP keeps it out, to the leg side.
slow offcutter at 114 kph, JP opens the face and steers it behind square. These two have added 50.
another slower ball - the lack of sideways movement for all but Kulasekara has been stark today. Kallis works it off the pads for one more.
short of a length outside off, JP slaps it into the covers and there's a misfield to allow a single.
back of a length and cutting in, Kallis steers it behind square for a single.
that went away from JP from a length, but he saw it coming and nudged with the angle for a single behind point.
full length to JP, who can't time the drive into the covers.
full length once more, JP drives into the covers.
pitched up on the toes, JP clips it to midwicket for one.
almost the perfect yorker, Kallis digs it out to mid-off and sets off for an avoidable single ... The throw misses, and he was putting in the hard yards to make it.
bouncer, JP isn't known to enjoy them. He ducks under this particular one.
near yorker, but a foot wide of off, allows JP to dig it  out and get a single to point.
Kallis is gone! Prasad has his third, Kallis had backed away and was looking to go over extra cover, he ended up slicing it to the man on the sweeper cover boundary who judged the tumbling take well
tight single, pushes a fullish one just wide of mid-off and takes the throw on, makes it just about
he is away with a stroke that looked like fetching him not more than one, he just came forward and pushed the length ball, he got it wide enough of sweeper cover to rush back for the second
shot! this one comes in from a length, slowly as well, he waits and then wristily puts it away behind square leg
he is looking in serious touch, allows this one to come on and guides it past point easily
gets a back of a length ball on the pads and tucks it to fine leg
gets across to a widish full delivery going across him, and slaps it towards extra cover
goes for the yorker, does not get it quite in the blockhole, he gets well across, and jams it away in front of square leg
another near-yorker, just outside off stump, he waits in the crease and guides it late to third man
zooms in very full, and de Villiers can only jam it away on the leg side
full again, but the angle is towards the pads, and he whips it to deep square for one more
the attempted yorker to Duminy goes very full on to the pads and is helped square for a single, he has been around that blockhole, but hasn't quite found it consistently today
down the track but too close to the pitch and digs it back
low full toss on the pads, worked wide of deep square for a couple
leaves the crease and connects well, but finds midwicket in the way
full ball pushed back to the bowler
this time he manages to dig a full one past midwicket to long on
comes down the track, Herath fires it in towards the pads, it loops up on the leg side
eep, he goes for a furious reverse sweep, does not connect, loses his balance, but was struck well outside off
conventional sweep earns him a single to fine leg
worked off the pads for one in front of square leg
he goes for another reverse sweep, and gets it away, did not lunge as hard as he did on the previous occasion, went a bit further, and got it away to the deep point boundary
off the inside edge towards short fine leg, and Duminy is through in an instant
pushed down the ground to long on
carrom ball, JP seemed to pick it and steers it to third man for two.

byebye cricket ball. Duminy has sent one back to Paarl. Skims out of the crease, gets into the inch-perfect position for the loft and then packs an extra bit of vengeance as he tees off. The crowd gets a collective neck strain trying to where that went. Replacement balls come in.
fires a full and flat ball on the toes, and JP whips square for one.
Ab pushes a single into the midwicket area. What a change his entrance has sparked.
stays back and defends down the track.
full on the pads, JP milks a single through backward square leg. Superb 50 from JP, since no one's noticed him getting there until he sent that ball into orbit. Just that one boundary.
slow offcutter outside off, JP dabs it away behind square for a single.
short of a length outside off, and AB works it after skipping out for a single to midwicket.
on JP's pads and he's tucked behind square for a couple more.

AB is gone! Come on South Africa, surely you aren't doing it again! JP dabs a short of length ball behind point and takes off. If there's one batsman who could have completed that run, it was AB. The ball went straight to Nuwan Kula at short third man. Why did they run? Kula arrows down the stumps and that's that for the SA captain.
short ball to welcome Faf to the crease. He pulls in slightly awry, but effective fashion, to get a single.
slow bumper now, it was dug in real short and looped over the batsman's head. Wide called.
on the pads now, JP nudges to the leg side for one. He has to bat through here for SA.
full ball on off stump, JP can't quite dig it out.
short of a length and angling across, JP cuts it through the point area and gets a single.
full length at 124 kph, too many singles on offer. Faf takes his through the covers.
angled across again, worked through the covers for a single.
full ball angling into the pads, and Faf chips inside the line and nudges to the leg side for a single.
JP punches to long-off now and gets one more single away.
full length ball on off stump, JP pushes towards mid-off.
attempted yorker on the toes, JP whips it square for a single.
pacy low full toss on the toes, Faf works it towards fine leg for a single.
another yorker on the off stump, JP digs it out to the off side.
the yorkers aren't quite hitting the spot today. 138 kph, just short of the blockhole, and JP drives it past the bowler for a single.
another nervy single, but Faf makes it. He's quick too. Yorker squeezed out to mid-on, and he's away. The throw misses, but he was in in any case.
Faf gets a crucial four away. He skips out to a legspinner slower ball and helps it along over point with the turn.
full ball on middle and leg, shovelled down the ground with the bottom hand for a single.
another full ball outside off, JP drives down the ground for one more.
low full toss on the pads, Faf turns it away square with the angle for a single.
Kula keeps it full, but at his pace it's not bothering JP. Worked through midwicket for a single.

top-edge! Swirls high and wild, but lands safely in front of fine leg. Short ball, Faf was already advancing and went through with the pull. Didn't have any control on it, else it might have carried to the fielder.
another full ball homes in on Faf's toes and he clips it square for a single.
JP stays in the crease and manouvres a full ball towards midwicket.
width on this attempted yorker, JP uses the pace to guide it to third man for a single.
full ball to Faf, who drives to mid-off. SL need wickets, the odd dot ball won't do.
there, more evidence of a wonky radar. The attempted yorker ends up a full toss at knee height on leg stump and Faf easily glances it to fine leg for four. SA are taking this away.
slow bouncer to end the over, Faf misses the pull.
JP tries to go downtown and miscues a loft  down the ground. Mid-on was inside the circle, though, and he gets away with it.
slow offcutter, JP misses the guide to third man.
short of a length, that came in a touch as JP tried to dab square. Inside edge, flits away past the stumps.
Faf skips out of the crease, and slaps a short ball to the square leg area for a single.
another slower ball, JP again misses the dab behind square on the off side.
another slower ball, JP pushes it to mid-off who comes across quickly to field it.
angled into the pads, Faf tries to nudge with the angle but can't get it away.

Faf's gone. Malinga is still not done with this game. The yorkers haven't worked today, but the slower balls are. Slow offcutter, stops on Faf who pats it right back after committing to the drive too early. Malinga takes the return catch well.

Malinga's dropped him first ball! Another full ball that came on slowly, Albie is early on the drive down the ground. It went low to Malinga this time and he couldn't grab, though he got both hands to it.
very low full toss at 136 kph, that seemed to swing in the air. Albie manages to keep it out, pushing it to mid-off from the crease.
that's probably the best yorker he's bowled today. nearly snaked under Albie's bat as he jammed down on it, but he managed to keep it out. Game not over folks.
ah well, just as I say that, he's missed a yorker by half a foot. Low full toss in Albie's slot and he whips four crucial runs to deep midwicket.
full length ball on the off stump, JP's taking singles everywhere. This time to long-off.
another effortlessly efficient clip off the pads from Albie and SA have two more.
back of a length, Albie covers the line and plays into the off side.
low full tosses have been the order of the day. Here's another one, and Albie drives a single to the left of mid-off.
over-pitched outside off, JP absolutely kills the drive, but finds mid-off.
short ball, JP is early on the pull and misses, but it angles away harmlessly.
flat ball outside off, Albie mistimes a push off the back foot, and it goes back to Dilshan.
Albie goes down on a knee and tries to dump Dilshan's flighted ball into the grass banks beyong cow corner, but misses. The ball lands outside off and spins away. Nerves!
over-pitched on the stumps, Albie drives it back down the ground and times it pretty well. Long-on saves the boundary, but Albie has two more.

The game ends. Dilshan looks to almost be in tears. Sanga has missed a run out. Sri Lanka's biggest names have messed up again, and South Africa are 2-0 up. Short and turning away from Albie, who places the cut well between the two men on either side of point. He didn't time it too well, and the fielder who ran back managed to stop it inside the rope. JP was cramping by the time he turned back for the third but went for it. Sanga had to collect and take the stumps off, but he couldn't collect cleanly. The throw wasn't poor at all. Dilshan is livid. Kirsten and the crew are all smiles.
